title: 'South Africa deserved to win': Wales' Gatland accepts World Cup defeat – video
text:
Wales head coach Warren Gatland was magnanimous in defeat after his Wales side were edged out 19-16 to South Africa in the Rugby World Cup semi-final.

Handrè Pollard's 76th-minute penalty snatched victory for South Africa after Wales fought back in the second half to level the score 16-16. "We punch massively above our weight, in terms of playing numbers we have in Wales, so I'm really proud of the guys,' added Gatland. South Africa face England in the final next Saturday in Yokohama.

• Read Paul Rees' match report
description: Wales head coach Warren Gatland was magnanimous in defeat after his Wales side were edged out 19-16 to South Africa
